intro: Geonoma longisecta, commonly known as the long-lobed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are often divided into long, narrow segments. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are typically creeping and produce roots that help anchor it to moist soil or rock surfaces. The plant's intricate frond structure makes it a visually striking addition to botanical collections and natural habitats.
